intro: Agalmyla parvilimba, commonly known as the small-leaf agalmyla, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
